questions.text: Which film won the Academy Award for Best Picture in 1994?
questions.explanation: Forrest Gump won Best Picture at the 67th Academy Awards in 1995 for the 1994 film year.

questions.text: Who directed the 1975 film 'Jaws'?
questions.explanation: Steven Spielberg directed Jaws, which became the first summer blockbuster.

questions.text: In 'The Wizard of Oz' (1939), what color are Dorothy's slippers?
questions.explanation: Dorothy's iconic ruby red slippers were changed from silver (in the book) to take advantage of Technicolor.

questions.text: Which actor played Tony Montana in 'Scarface' (1983)?
questions.explanation: Al Pacino starred as Cuban drug lord Tony Montana in Brian De Palma's Scarface.

questions.text: What was the first feature-length animated film produced by Pixar?
questions.explanation: Toy Story (1995) was Pixar's first feature film and the first entirely computer-animated feature.

questions.text: Who directed 'Schindler's List' (1993)?
questions.explanation: Steven Spielberg directed Schindler's List, winning Best Director and Best Picture.

questions.text: Which 1997 film became the first to gross over $1 billion worldwide?
questions.explanation: James Cameron's Titanic was the first film to cross the $1 billion mark at the global box office.

questions.text: What is the name of the fictional continent in 'Black Panther'?
questions.explanation: Wakanda is the fictional African nation in Black Panther, known for its vibranium reserves.

questions.text: Who played the Joker in 'The Dark Knight' (2008)?
questions.explanation: Heath Ledger won a posthumous Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for his portrayal of the Joker.

questions.text: Which film features the quote 'Here's looking at you, kid'?
questions.explanation: Humphrey Bogart's character Rick Blaine says this iconic line in Casablanca (1942).

questions.text: How many films are in Peter Jackson's 'The Lord of the Rings' trilogy?
questions.explanation: The trilogy consists of The Fellowship of the Ring, The Two Towers, and The Return of the King.

questions.text: Which actress won the Academy Award for Best Actress for 'La La Land'?
questions.explanation: Emma Stone won Best Actress at the 89th Academy Awards for her role as Mia in La La Land.

questions.text: What year was the original 'Star Wars' (Episode IV) released?
questions.explanation: Star Wars: A New Hope was released on May 25, 1977, and became a cultural phenomenon.

questions.text: Who directed 'Pulp Fiction' (1994)?
questions.explanation: Quentin Tarantino wrote and directed Pulp Fiction, winning the Palme d'Or at Cannes.

questions.text: In 'The Silence of the Lambs', what is Hannibal Lecter's profession?
questions.explanation: Dr. Hannibal Lecter is a brilliant forensic psychiatrist and cannibalistic serial killer.

questions.text: Which film won the first Academy Award for Best Picture in 1929?
questions.explanation: Wings (1927) won Outstanding Picture at the 1st Academy Awards ceremony in 1929.

questions.text: What is the highest-grossing film of all time (unadjusted for inflation)?
questions.explanation: Avatar (2009) holds the record with over $2.9 billion worldwide, reclaiming the top spot after re-releases.

questions.text: Who played Vito Corleone in 'The Godfather' (1972)?
questions.explanation: Marlon Brando won the Best Actor Oscar for his role as Don Vito Corleone, though he declined the award.

questions.text: Which Disney animated film features the song 'Let It Go'?
questions.explanation: Frozen (2013) features the Oscar-winning song 'Let It Go' performed by Idina Menzel.

questions.text: Which director is known for the films 'Inception', 'Interstellar', and 'The Dark Knight'?
questions.explanation: Christopher Nolan directed all three of these critically acclaimed blockbusters.

questions.text: What fictional material is Captain America's shield made of?
questions.explanation: In the MCU, Captain America's shield is made of vibranium from Wakanda.

questions.text: Who directed '2001: A Space Odyssey' (1968)?
questions.explanation: Stanley Kubrick directed and co-wrote 2001: A Space Odyssey with Arthur C. Clarke.

questions.text: Which actress has won the most Academy Awards for acting?
questions.explanation: Katharine Hepburn won four Best Actress Oscars, more than any other actor or actress in history.

questions.text: In which film does Tom Hanks play a stranded FedEx employee?
questions.explanation: Cast Away (2000) stars Tom Hanks as Chuck Noland, a FedEx employee stranded on a deserted island.

questions.text: What is the name of the AI computer in '2001: A Space Odyssey'?
questions.explanation: HAL 9000 is the sentient computer that controls the Discovery One spacecraft.

questions.text: Which 1994 film is set primarily inside a prison called Shawshank?
questions.explanation: The Shawshank Redemption, based on a Stephen King novella, stars Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman.

questions.text: Who played Jack Dawson in 'Titanic' (1997)?
questions.explanation: Leonardo DiCaprio starred alongside Kate Winslet in James Cameron's Titanic.

questions.text: Which Pixar film is set in the world of emotions inside a girl's mind?
questions.explanation: Inside Out (2015) takes place inside the mind of Riley, featuring Joy, Sadness, Anger, Fear, and Disgust.

questions.text: What is Quentin Tarantino's first feature film?
questions.explanation: Reservoir Dogs (1992) was Tarantino's directorial debut and premiered at the Sundance Film Festival.

questions.text: Which film series features a character named Ethan Hunt?
questions.explanation: Tom Cruise plays IMF agent Ethan Hunt in the Mission: Impossible franchise.

questions.text: Who directed 'The Shining' (1980)?
questions.explanation: Stanley Kubrick directed The Shining, starring Jack Nicholson, based on Stephen King's novel.

questions.text: Which film features the line 'I see dead people'?
questions.explanation: Haley Joel Osment delivers this iconic line in M. Night Shyamalan's The Sixth Sense (1999).

questions.text: What is the name of Indiana Jones's signature weapon?
questions.explanation: Indiana Jones is famous for using a bullwhip, along with his fedora hat.

questions.text: Which film won Best Picture at the 2020 Academy Awards, making history as the first non-English language winner?
questions.explanation: Bong Joon-ho's Parasite (South Korea) won Best Picture at the 92nd Academy Awards in 2020.

questions.text: Who played Wolverine in the X-Men film series?
questions.explanation: Hugh Jackman played Wolverine/Logan across multiple X-Men films from 2000 to 2017.

questions.text: In the 'Matrix' trilogy, what color pill does Neo take?
questions.explanation: Neo chooses the red pill offered by Morpheus to learn the truth about the Matrix.

questions.text: Which Alfred Hitchcock film features the iconic shower scene?
questions.explanation: Psycho (1960) features the famous shower scene with Janet Leigh at the Bates Motel.

questions.text: What was the first film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe?
questions.explanation: Iron Man (2008), starring Robert Downey Jr., launched the MCU.

questions.text: Who directed 'Jurassic Park' (1993)?
questions.explanation: Steven Spielberg directed Jurassic Park, based on Michael Crichton's novel.

questions.text: Which actor plays John Wick in the action film series?
questions.explanation: Keanu Reeves stars as the legendary hitman John Wick in the franchise that began in 2014.

questions.text: Which 1939 film features the line 'Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn'?
questions.explanation: Clark Gable as Rhett Butler delivers this famous line in Gone with the Wind.

questions.text: What is the name of the fictional hotel in 'The Shining'?
questions.explanation: The Overlook Hotel is the haunted Colorado hotel where Jack Torrance and his family stay.

questions.text: Which animated film studio created 'Spirited Away'?
questions.explanation: Studio Ghibli, founded by Hayao Miyazaki and Isao Takahata, produced Spirited Away (2001).

questions.text: Who directed 'Get Out' (2017)?
questions.explanation: Jordan Peele directed Get Out, winning the Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay.

questions.text: In 'The Godfather', what is the name of the Corleone family's youngest son?
questions.explanation: Michael Corleone, played by Al Pacino, is the youngest son who reluctantly takes over the family business.

questions.text: Which film popularized the phrase 'May the Force be with you'?

options.C: Close Encounters of the Third Kind

questions.explanation: The phrase became iconic from the original Star Wars film (1977).

questions.text: Who played the title character in 'Edward Scissorhands' (1990)?
questions.explanation: Johnny Depp starred as Edward in Tim Burton's gothic fantasy film.

questions.text: What type of animal is Simba in 'The Lion King'?
questions.explanation: Simba is a lion and the main character in Disney's The Lion King (1994).

questions.text: Which director made 'Goodfellas' (1990) and 'The Departed' (2006)?
questions.explanation: Martin Scorsese directed both crime films. He won his first Best Director Oscar for The Departed.

questions.text: What is the name of the hobbit played by Elijah Wood in 'The Lord of the Rings'?
questions.explanation: Elijah Wood plays Frodo Baggins, the ring-bearer tasked with destroying the One Ring.

questions.text: Which 2019 film directed by Bong Joon-ho follows a poor family infiltrating a wealthy household?
questions.explanation: Parasite follows the Kim family as they scheme their way into employment with the wealthy Park family.

questions.text: Who composed the music for most of Steven Spielberg's films, including 'Jaws' and 'E.T.'?
questions.explanation: John Williams has composed scores for nearly all of Spielberg's films over their decades-long collaboration.

questions.text: In which city is 'Blade Runner' (1982) set?
questions.explanation: Blade Runner is set in a dystopian Los Angeles in November 2019.

questions.text: Which actress starred as Clarice Starling in 'The Silence of the Lambs' (1991)?
questions.explanation: Jodie Foster won the Best Actress Oscar for her portrayal of FBI trainee Clarice Starling.

questions.text: What is the subtitle of the second 'Godfather' film?
questions.explanation: The Godfather Part II (1974) is one of the rare sequels to also win Best Picture.

questions.text: Which actor has portrayed James Bond the most times in official films?
questions.explanation: Roger Moore appeared as Bond in seven official films from 1973 to 1985.

questions.text: What genre is 'The Exorcist' (1973)?
questions.explanation: The Exorcist is a landmark horror film about demonic possession, directed by William Friedkin.

questions.text: Which Wes Anderson film features a hotel concierge named Gustave H.?
questions.explanation: Ralph Fiennes plays M. Gustave H. in The Grand Budapest Hotel (2014).

questions.text: Who played the lead role in 'Gladiator' (2000)?
questions.explanation: Russell Crowe won the Best Actor Oscar for playing Maximus in Ridley Scott's Gladiator.

questions.text: Which film is known for the twist that the main character was dead all along?
questions.explanation: The Sixth Sense reveals that Bruce Willis's character, Dr. Malcolm Crowe, has been dead throughout the film.

questions.text: In what decade was the Academy Awards ceremony first held?
questions.explanation: The first Academy Awards ceremony was held on May 16, 1929, at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel.

questions.text: Which Coen Brothers film features a character named Anton Chigurh?
questions.explanation: Javier Bardem plays the menacing Anton Chigurh in No Country for Old Men (2007), winning Best Supporting Actor.

questions.text: Which actress played Furiosa in 'Mad Max: Fury Road' (2015)?
questions.explanation: Charlize Theron played Imperator Furiosa in George Miller's critically acclaimed Mad Max: Fury Road.

questions.text: What is the name of the kingdom in Disney's 'Frozen'?
questions.explanation: Arendelle is the Scandinavian-inspired kingdom where Elsa and Anna live.

questions.text: Who directed 'Apocalypse Now' (1979)?
questions.explanation: Francis Ford Coppola directed Apocalypse Now, loosely based on Joseph Conrad's Heart of Darkness.

questions.text: Which film features a character saying 'You talking to me?'
questions.explanation: Robert De Niro improvised this famous mirror scene in Martin Scorsese's Taxi Driver (1976).

questions.text: What is the name of the planet where the Na'vi live in 'Avatar'?
questions.explanation: Pandora is the lush, alien moon in James Cameron's Avatar (2009).

questions.text: Which 1999 film stars Keanu Reeves as a hacker who discovers reality is a simulation?
questions.explanation: The Matrix, directed by the Wachowskis, stars Reeves as Neo, who discovers the truth about the Matrix.

questions.text: Who won the Best Director Oscar for 'Birdman' (2014)?
questions.explanation: Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu won Best Director and Best Picture for Birdman, filmed to appear as one continuous shot.

questions.text: In which film does Morgan Freeman play a prison inmate named Red?
questions.explanation: Morgan Freeman plays Ellis Boyd 'Red' Redding in The Shawshank Redemption (1994).

questions.text: Which film franchise includes 'The Chamber of Secrets' and 'The Prisoner of Azkaban'?
questions.explanation: These are the second and third films in the Harry Potter series based on J.K. Rowling's books.

questions.text: Who directed 'Do the Right Thing' (1989)?
questions.explanation: Spike Lee wrote, directed, and starred in Do the Right Thing, set in a Brooklyn neighborhood.

questions.text: What is Rosebud in 'Citizen Kane' (1941)?
questions.explanation: Rosebud is revealed to be the name of Charles Foster Kane's childhood sled.

questions.text: Which film won Leonardo DiCaprio his first Academy Award for Best Actor?
questions.explanation: DiCaprio won his first Best Actor Oscar for The Revenant (2015), directed by Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu.

questions.text: Which Hayao Miyazaki film features a young girl working in a bathhouse for spirits?
questions.explanation: Spirited Away (2001) follows Chihiro as she works in Yubaba's bathhouse. It won the Best Animated Feature Oscar.

questions.text: In 'Back to the Future', what type of car is the time machine?
questions.explanation: Doc Brown's time machine is built from a DeLorean DMC-12, requiring 1.21 gigawatts of power.

questions.text: Which film features the quote 'After all, tomorrow is another day'?
questions.explanation: Scarlett O'Hara (Vivien Leigh) delivers this final line in Gone with the Wind (1939).

questions.text: Who directed 'Everything Everywhere All at Once' (2022)?
questions.explanation: The Daniels (Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert) directed the film, which won seven Oscars including Best Picture.

questions.text: What is the highest-grossing R-rated film of all time?
questions.explanation: Deadpool & Wolverine (2024) became the highest-grossing R-rated film, surpassing Joker's record.

questions.text: Which director is famous for appearing in cameos in his own films, including 'Psycho' and 'Rear Window'?
questions.explanation: Alfred Hitchcock made brief cameo appearances in 40 of his 52 surviving major films.
